programme.desc: Ben Macintyre concludes his history of formation of the British Army special forces unit. With David Stirling locked away in Hitler's most secure prison Colditz, the leadership of the SAS passed to Paddy Mayne, a man who built his reputation on the battlefield as a warrior of the first rank. In 1943, the SAS leaves the desert for Europe to enter a darker and far more complex theatre of war, where they face the threat of execution and the trauma of civilian casualties, as well as being the first to witness the nightmare of Bergen-Belsen concentration camp.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. The moors and valleys of West Yorkshire were the home of, and inspiration for, the Brontes, the literary family who produced such classics as Wuthering Heights and Jane Eyre. Over four days, Tony heads out from the Victorian wool capital of Bradford and treks in a giant loop around what is now known as Bronte Country. From the birth of Charlotte, Emily, Anne and their brother Branwell in the suburb of Thornton, he traces their childhoods to the much-romanticised Bronte hub of Haworth, finding that the harsh reality of life in the 1820s was far removed from the fantasy world dreamed up by the children at their father's parsonage home.

programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Norman Conquest of Pembrokeshire
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to the south-west corner of Wales and one of Britain's finest coastal paths to find out why Pembrokeshire feels so English, even though it's more than 100 miles from the border. With its numerous castles and a fine cathedral, there are sure signs the Normans stamped their mark over the area. Tony's four-day walk traces the story of their conquest of the county, which he discovers was very different from the knockout victory at Hastings, involving a long, fiercely fought struggle.

programme.title: Duran Duran: There's Something You Should Know
programme.desc: Simon Le Bon, John Taylor, Nick Rhodes and Roger Taylor open up about the highs and lows of the band's career - with archive footage of former guitarist Andy Taylor helping round out the story. The documentary charts their trajectory through seven of their 14 albums, each one uncovering a compelling chapter in the history of five lads from Birmingham who had one simple dream - to become the biggest band in the world. Contributors include Boy George, Nile Rodgers and Mark Ronson.

programme.title: Fleetwood Mac - Don't Stop
programme.desc: Documentary looking back over the band's long career, from the early blues outfit led by Peter Green in the late 1960s, to their reincarnation in the 1970s with the line-up that went on to record the 40-million-selling album Rumours. Mick Fleetwood, John McVie, Lindsey Buckingham and Stevie Nicks reveal the truth behind the successes, failures and relationships that characterised their music and made them one of the most enduring acts in popular music.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drag a mini pickup out of the barn where it's been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores nature's evolutionary anomalies and examines two creatures whose stretched features have given them an edge in the natural world. The chameleon has an extra-long tongue that helps it catch prey and the giraffe's neck is so long it is easily able to reach the tops of trees for food.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough highlights the curiosities that have led to accusations of forgery, but have ultimately helped assist the rethinking of evolution. When early explorers brought the first specimen of a duck-billed platypus to England in 1799, it was considered so bizarre it was deemed a hoax. Similarly, the midwife toad became the centre of a scientific storm in the 1920s that led to accusations of fakery.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures' habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. Marine iguanas in the Galapagos Islands are preyed on by racer snakes from birth, while penguins on the Antarctic island of Zavodovski risk being battered against the rocks by fierce waves.

programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.desc: The first of three programmes about the wildlife, landscape and culture in different areas of the country explores the Sierra Madre mountains, and reveals how this rugged landscape has shaped the nation. This chain of peaks includes several volcanoes and is home to a wide variety of animals, including black bears, monarch butterflies, orchid bees and quetzals. The programme also visits the ruins of an ancient Aztec shrine and the blue agave plant which grows in the mountains is used in making tequila.

programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.desc: Exploring the forests of the Yucatan Peninsula, which contain the ruins of the Mayan civilisation and a wide range of wildlife, including jaguars, monkeys and tropical birds. The region also holds a secret that is the key to how Mexico's people and animals are able to survive during the country's dry season.

programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.desc: The series concludes by exploring the north of the country, which is dominated by two deserts - the Sonoran and the Chihuahuan. The programme explores the conditions that have shaped this environment, and reveals how animals including prairie dogs, pygmy owls and aplomado falcons have adapted to thrive in these arid conditions.

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Footage of marine life in different environments around the north, beginning with a tropical coral reef which has medicinal properties for dolphins, and is used as a tool by tusk fish. In Japan, a shipwreck is home to the Asian sheepshead wrasse, which can change gender, while in the polar north, walruses struggle to find ice floes for their pups to rest on as climate change takes its toll on the environment.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: King John's Ruin - Peak District
programme.desc: As the 800th anniversary of the signing of Magna Carta in June 1215 approaches, Tony Robinson sets out to discover the real King John. His walk across the medieval monarch's stamping grounds of Sherwood Forest and the Peak District reveals a hapless man stumbling from crisis to crisis who, in the end, had no choice but to sign away some of his power. In the midst of what are now cultivated fields, Tony finds the scant remains of Laxton Castle, once the control centre where strict 'forest law' was administered and where taxes and fines flooded into the royal coffers. Later, in Sherwood, he explores how the myth of Robin Hood has helped to skew the public's image of King John.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson hikes up from Lyme Regis on Dorset's Jurassic Coast to the Somerset Levels in the footsteps of a ragtag rebel army led by the young Duke of Monmouth, the illegitimate son of Charles II. He sailed in from Holland around Lyme's famous Cobb with a handful of soldiers, believing the people would support him in overthrowing the newly crowned James II, who was also Monmouth's uncle, but, more importantly, Roman Catholic. The year was 1685 and the country was riven by anti-Catholic feeling mixed up with revolutionary zeal. Monmouth marched through the fiercely independent towns of Devon, gathering support from artisans and farmworkers. Meeting up with Billy Bragg in Colyton, Tony learns about the kind of people prepared to risk their lives for the Monmouth Rebellion.

programme.desc: A fuel plant in Poland built to make Nazi Germany self-sufficient by using the latest technology of the time to turn coal into oil.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Documentary series exploring the motivations of key figures in Hitler's regime, beginning with propaganda master Josef Goebbels.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second of two episodes from Balmoral, where she takes a tour of the grounds in a 1953 land rover and views archive footage of the royal family. programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on another journey around the nation with a copy of George Bradshaw's Victorian Railway Guidebook to discover how the railways have affected people and what remains of Bradshaw's Britain. He begins by travelling from High Wycombe, Buckinghamshire, to Stratford-upon-Avon in Warwickshire, finding out about the remarkable craftsmen behind the Victorian furniture trade, discovering how George Bradshaw helped save Britain's canal heritage and seeing Shakespeare through the eyes of a 19th-century rail tourist.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo learns how the railways helped to make Birmingham the pen-making capital of the world, hears the chilling tale of one of 19th-century Britain's most notorious murderers and samples delicacies concocted in a Victorian kitchen at Shugborough Hall, Staffordshire.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a Christmas special from Lyme Park in Cheshire, where she and toy expert Will Farmer look back at children's Christmas presents dating back to Edwardian times. In the house's gardens, over 2000 visitors have arrived to have their items valued, including many with a royal heritage. The programme features a cup and saucer once owned by the Queen, a pram from Buckingham Palace, and a dagger believed to have been owned by Charles I. Plus, a celebration of the works of Charles Dickens.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The wildlife on the great plains of Africa, Asia, North America and the Arctic, which cover a quarter of the land on Earth. The distinctive Tibetan fox is captured on film for the first time, while a herd of caribou migrates 2,000 miles across the tundra in search of grass. Night vision equipment tracks a pride of 30 lions hunting elephants in the tropical African savannah near one of the region's few remaining waterholes. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn rides up Mount Snowdon's railway to visit the summit station, and discovers how a glass structure envelopes Strasbourg's 19th-century station.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Miserly shopkeeper Arkwright organises a sales drive in a bid to boost profits - and rid himself of the vast consignment of apples he has mistakenly ordered. An unhappy Granville is persuaded to demonstrate the merchandise. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Nurse Gladys Emmanuel's washing-machine breaks down, and Arkwright decides to try and lure her into his home with the offer of his vintage machine.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville struggles to find some privacy when the milkwoman makes a pass at him. Nurse Gladys Emmanuel steps in by persuading Arkwright to take her to a hotel.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie faces his worst nightmare when Marlene's sister decides to pay a visit from Peckham. As if the man-eating glamourpuss was not enough to cope with, he finds all his staff tied up in the barn - and realises his past has come back to haunt him. Guest starring Paula Wilcox.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson hikes up from Lyme Regis on Dorset's Jurassic Coast to the Somerset Levels in the footsteps of a ragtag rebel army led by the young Duke of Monmouth, the illegitimate son of Charles II. He sailed in from Holland around Lyme's famous Cobb with a handful of soldiers, believing the people would support him in overthrowing the newly crowned James II, who was also Monmouth's uncle, but, more importantly, Roman Catholic. The year was 1685 and the country was riven by anti-Catholic feeling mixed up with revolutionary zeal. Monmouth marched through the fiercely independent towns of Devon, gathering support from artisans and farmworkers. Meeting up with Billy Bragg in Colyton, Tony learns about the kind of people prepared to risk their lives for the Monmouth Rebellion.

They are helped in their investigation by anthropologist Fiona Kennedy, for whom Dan begins to develop feelings - just as he is told his wife might be discharged from the secure hospital where she has spent the past several years. Charlie Gimbert eventually buys the property, and agrees to rent the stables for Lovejoy Antiques. Patricia Hayes guest stars in an episode directed by Ian McShane.

programme.desc: The dodgy dealer is threatened by a debt collector over a long outstanding sum and his hopes of meeting the repayment rest on a silver tankard, and hijacking a local auction administered by Charlotte Cavendish to obtain an antique piece of Japanese pottery. Meanwhile, newcomer Beth Taylor gives Eric and Tinker a helping hand. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A serial arsonist targets sites related to the 1983 general election. After risking his life in a burning building following a quiet word from Keats, Ray gets personally involved in the high-profile investigation - which forces him to face his traumatic past as it becomes clear the tragic events of the Falklands War are driving the firestarter to murder. Fantasy drama, with Dean Andrews and Joe Absolom (Doc Martin).

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Gene jeopardises a covert operation into a drug cartel when he learns several dealers have been murdered recently and the crimes are linked to an old adversary. Chris falls for the attractive undercover officer, but his feelings prompt a violent outburst that threatens his future in the police, and Alex gathers more clues about why she remains in the 1980s. With guest star Zoe Telford (Criminal Justice).

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry and the team agree to help a man who believes his wife is still alive, even though she apparently died 18 months earlier in a car accident. They decide the best way to convince him is to have her exhumed - only to be faced with more questions than answers when it turns out the body is not hers after all. Meanwhile, Brian needs to find a handyman when Esther bans him from his latest DIY project. Hugh Dennis and Samuel West guest star, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reopens the investigation into an actress's disappearance when clips of her being assaulted in a 1990 movie are posted on the internet. Director Don Maddox features in the footage, but when questioned, he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction. A potential witness is then found dead, and Brian and Jack are seconded to the unit handling the case, only to find Emily Driscoll (Dennis Waterman's daughter Hannah) is heading the operation. Imogen Stubbs and Sandra Dickinson also guest star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reinvestigates the death of a timeshare magnate, previously thought to have committed suicide, when a reformed call girl claims she was with him the night he died and saw someone force their way into his house as she left. It then emerges the deceased's widow has since fallen on hard times after being swindled by her late husband's business partner - who is connected to a notorious criminal. Guest starring Shane Richie, Naomi Bentley and Claire Rushbrook.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy says farewell to the Fusiliers. Complications during a live firing exercise results in a secret coming up to the surface. Starring Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: New recruit Andy Butcher is overjoyed to be going on a live-firing exercise almost straight away, but soon makes a devastating mistake. As Marsha's troubles deepen, she finds solace in a bottle and spurns all offers of help from her friends, while Williams and Phillips' relationship reaches a turning point.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Dale Smith ignores a warning from lover Louise to save his own skin and foolishly continues searching Larson's home for the gun used in the Garrison shooting. When he fails to show up at Sun Hill, Nadir is forced to tell Jack Meadows what has been going on. Roger Valentine makes fun of Tony Stamp's hearing problem, but a routine check-up at the hospital proves anything but funny.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Enigmatic new consultant Dan Clifford turns up at the hospital and examines the kidney transplant case, while a worried Abra covers his tracks. Elliot is forced to finally confront his demons over Gina's death and Connie reveals she is pregnant to a stunned Sam. Medical drama, with Peter Wingfield and Adrian Edmondson.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Barney treats a group of Spice Girl lookalikes, and Andrew tries to calm an irate Duffy who announced she's having the baby whether he likes it or not. Meanwhile, Holly receives another gift from her secret admirer, and suspects Patrick may be behind the offering. Starring Cathy Shipton, Philip Bretherton and Ronnie McCann.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Worried about his future position at Sun Hill, DC Carver maps out a new career. However, his colleagues are a little sceptical about his plan. Iain Fletcher stars.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant and Phil have a word of warning for Richard, while Ian has a surprise for Cindy.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Shelley thinks that a holiday might help her relationship, but Mark has other ideas. Arthur is having car trouble, and Grant gets an unexpected visitor.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Sicknote goes metal detecting. Meanwhile, A fire that has broken out at a house ends in tragedy, and Gregg steals the show at Jaffa's talent contest.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: The three doctors fall out when a consultant refuses to operate on their heart patient because he is a heavy smoker. Jack is unhappy because Beth has rejected his proposal and Will's marriage suffers another setback. Medical drama, starring Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Sally is shocked by news of Megan's pregnancy and her mood is soured further by the discovery that Kim already knows about it. Work matters prove just as complicated when the nurses help a teenager in need of a kidney transplant whose health is further threatened by tensions between potential organ donors in her family. Guest starring Frances Barber and Stella Gonet alongside Samantha Giles, Holly Grainger and Denise Van Outen.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: An activity weekend lands Dorien in hospital - where she is mortified that the private doctors might think she fraternises with the likes of Sharon and Tracey. Veteran TV weatherman Ian McCaskill appears as himself.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey reprimands DeVere for not fulfilling his duties as lord of the manor when he fails to attend church on Sunday, but then forgets to practise what she preaches. Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo speculates why blood rushes to the head when upside down but not to the feet while standing up, so Seymour sets up an experiment to demonstrate the way the body works. Comedy, starring Bill Owen and Michael Aldridge.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo pulls a piece of antique silver from the canal, and Seymour sets about recovering any other items down there, with the intention of returning them to their rightful owners.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Dalziel meets an attractive British singer during a European police conference, but wakes up to find her dead and himself accused of murder. Released on bail, he begins inquiries into the case which yield a complex story of diamond dealing and police corruption. Michael French guest stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The arrest of a Turkish girl who has been working illegally leads Ucos to reopen the case of Richard Gibson, a pub landlord who died in a fire in 2009. The original investigation concluded Gibson's death was probably suicide due to his dire financial situation, but the detectives have some questions about the pub's live-in barmaid, who disappeared on the night of the blaze. Could widowed landlady Joanne, pub regular Jason, or the dead man's best friend David, who happens to have a sideline in passing off his British-produced sparkling wine as French champagne, supply them with any answers? While the case tests the team's brain power, Sasha is also keen to raise their fitness levels as she signs them up for a five-a-side football competition. Phil Davis, Niamh Cusack and Tom Georgeson guest star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The Home Office asks Sam and her team to re-examine the work of an independent pathologist. Harry's patience is tested to the limit by the investigation. Feature-length crime drama, starring Amanda Burton, Mick Ford and William Armstrong.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The lads reach South Africa where they help complete the building of a medical centre, leading to romance for Jeremy, who falls for one of the nurses. programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Spencer runs into an old Navy colleague while attending a funeral - only to find he has a much younger, pregnant fiancee whose father is hot on his heels. Patrick arrives when the girl is suffering chest pains, and the pair are held hostage by the disapproving parent. Medical drama series, starring Ian Kelsey and Ben Keaton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Worried about his future position at Sun Hill, DC Carver maps out a new career. However, his colleagues are a little sceptical about his plan. Iain Fletcher stars.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: A ghost from Kathy's past returns to haunt her, Richard has a date with an old flame, and Mark is exasperated by Shelley's behaviour.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Kathy makes a decision which changes her life, while Ricky leaves Frank speechless when he describes his new job.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch face a tough challenge when a fire breaks out in an indoor market. Meanwhile, Carol takes romance a step further.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack is caught in a dilemma when he has to tell his best friends that Chloe has cancer, and his relationship with Beth continues to deteriorate, prompting her to make radical decisions about her future. Drama, starring Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Sally bans Megan from seeing Luke and makes her feelings about her daughter's pregnancy very clear, which only serves to bring the teenagers closer together. A team-building exercise for the factory workers reaches a dramatic climax and the nurses help a woman suffering from alopecia come clean about her relationship with a younger man. Guest starring Jan Francis and Chris Bisson.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey discovers more than she bargained for while sorting out jumble for a car-boot sale after chancing upon an old photo album. Linda Robson stars.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: DeVere moves his multinational grocery business to the manor and clashes with Audrey over the removal of a fireplace that he considers ugly and she believes is intrinsic to the property. Comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: An afternoon driving around in Wesley's car proves to be tough on the feet. Compo is suffering from hard skin and places his faith in a herbal jelly from a gypsy healer. Bill Owen stars.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg and Seymour visit an old friend in hospital following his hernia operation and go to extraordinary lengths to cheer him up. Peter Sallis and Michael Aldridge star in the first episode to feature Clem 'Smiler' Hemmingway (Stephen Lewis).

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The judge must decide the fate of a sick baby which has been refused further resuscitation by doctors. The infant's deeply religious parents disagree, and take the fight for their son's life to court. Meanwhile, a boy convicted of theft dies in custody - bringing Deed's own traumatic memories of childhood to the fore. Drama, starring Martin Shaw.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Steve McAndrew brings his dying father to London so he can spend his final days in a nearby hospice, but how much time he can spend with his parent is anyone's guess - the Ucos team is hard at work investigating the cold case murder of 55-year-old interpreter Agnes Bradley. A DNA sample provides a link to a rebellious teenager, and the team wonders if the killer could be related to him. But a whole new can of worms is opened when investigators discover the lad's mother was raped - could the same person have killed Agnes? Gerry and Steve hope that interviewing her friends from a local chess club may shed new light on the matter, but it's a possible professional issue that could hold the key to unlocking the mystery. Denis Lawson and Dennis Waterman star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Amanda Burton's last appearance as forensic pathologist Professor Sam Ryan. When the bodies of two men are exposed by a landslide in Ireland, the subsequent investigation suggests the pair died in the sectarian violence of the 1970s, prompting Sam to make a long overdue and painful journey home. Bryan Murray, William Gaminara and Tom Ward also star.

programme.desc: Jeremy announces he is planning to marry his girlfriend, but is surprised at his friends' response. Meanwhile, Cate Hobbs receives bad news.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Lilian receives a visitor from beyond the grave while honeymooning with Jeremy, while Deborah's dalliance with drugs leads to her spending the eve of her wedding in prison. A truck carrying men and weapons to Aldershot is ambushed by hooded mercenaries and Chris' intervention leads to him being shot and taken hostage.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An armed robbery case leads Phil Hunter and Jo Masters to the door of petty criminal Gareth Dickson, who is making and selling firearms so shoddy they are a danger to the user - as his eight-year-old nephew seems keen to prove. Gina Gold gets a warm welcome back at Sun Hill, but for Sheelagh Murphy the return to work following the death of fiance David Kent brings a crisis of confidence and a confession she's thinking of resigning.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Leanne's dad Steve tells Lola he is ready to have his baby back but she refuses to believe he is off drugs and demands that he be tested. Meanwhile, Matt gets cold feet when questioned about his relationship with Nikki, and Elliot continues to come to terms with Gina's death. Medical drama, with Paul Bradley.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A local politician risks her career when her illicit lover is trapped inside a hotel after an explosion. As Charlie and Max attempt to rescue the injured man from the rubble, the miscreant MP deliberates whether she should take Charlie's advice to follow her heart and spend what could be his last moments with him. With a guest appearance by Star Trek: The Next Generation's Marina Sirtis.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sheelagh Murphy announces she's transferring to the Child Protection Unit at Croydon and Roger Valentine has temptation put in his way by bent copper Harry Haynes, the man he's investigating. As the coroner's hearing into the death of David Kent approaches, June Ackland nervously prepares to meet her long-lost son Gabriel, and a barrage of questions about his father forces her to reveal the circumstances under which she became pregnant.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Robbie's actions come home to roost. Insurance investigations of the car lot fire drives Frank into action. Grant lies to Sharon about Dougie. Phil checks out a face from the past.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant discovers Dougie has altered the arrangements for the supermart robbery. Sharon increases pressure on Grant. Phil tries to help Kathy to come to terms with the past.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A short circuit causes havoc at a children's party, and Blue Watch have to save a man hanging over an electrical transformer. Starring Andrew Kazamia.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack is shocked and angry when Beth is assaulted by a patient's father. Drama, starring Amanda Burton, Sam Shepherd and Kevin Whately.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Simon Goddard's return from Australia worries the locals, but the former factory owner declares he is only visiting his daughter Amy. Kim enjoys the company of Alistair and his family, leaving Danny green with envy. Joe and Alice prepare to come clean about their relationship - until a bad-tempered Harding makes them change their mind.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey tries to help ex-con Desmond, but Sharon is convinced he is a lost cause - and she is soon proved right. Linda Robson and Pauline Quirke star.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey takes a holiday, but frets about leaving her beloved Grantleigh Manor in DeVere's hands. Penelope Keith stars.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: When the Teesdales stop to give Clegg, Compo and Seymour a lift home from their caravanning holiday, Mrs T tries to fight off a feeling of discomfort as it becomes apparent the trio are determined to help park the caravan in their drive. Peter Sallis stars.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg makes himself scarce after learning Nora, Ivy and Edie want to pair him up with a timid woman who he once knew at school. Peter Sallis stars.

programme.title: Inspector Alleyn Mysteries
programme.desc: An investigation gets under way when barrister Luke Watchman dies of cyanide poisoning during his annual holiday at an inn. Crime drama, starring Patrick Malahide, Kevin McNally and William Simons.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Back in 1983, 16-year-old Amy Taskerland was murdered on the night of the school disco. More than 30 years later, the unearthing of a time capsule and the discovery of her voice on a mix tape inside prompts Miller and co to delve back into the case, starting by interviewing Amy's best friend Harriet and her former teacher Mr Hines. The recording features a strange mix of music and poetry, including words from a speech written in secret for the Queen for broadcast in the event of a nuclear war. But how did Amy get a copy of it, and was its secret nature the reason she was killed? Elsewhere, Miller enjoys her first romance since her divorce, while Gerry goes on his future son-in-law's stag night. Amy Nuttall (Emmerdale, Downton Abbey) and Jack Shepherd (Wycliffe) guest star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Emilia Fox joins the cast of the crime drama as Dr Nikki Alexander, who uses the team's equipment to solve an Iron Age mystery, but ends up bringing her expertise to bear on a modern murder. The case in question is the death of a jockey crushed by his mount during a race. The plot thickens when two of the horses' owners are killed in a helicopter crash and evidence emerges that both the horse and the pilot were drugged. James Wilby and Sylvestra Le Touzel guest star.

The first edition sees Alexander begin in Scandinavia and head toward Iceland, as he swims with locals in the ocean, faces the worst storm in 25 years, and goes down the world's first major tunnel to be built into the heart of a glacier.

programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Lucy, Chris, Cameron and Jessica pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Cain and Aaron are trying to adjust to life in lockdown and Cain is adamant he won't be opening up about his feelings. When a letter arrives with a prison stamp on it, Cain, not wanting Aaron to slip back into his hole of despair over Robert, hides the letter in a magazine.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Sally is swayed by Yasmeen's change of heart when she enters a not guilty plea, while back on the street, Geoff is furious and tells Tim they need to show a united front. Gary tracks down Laura to the address in Rochdale and promises to ensure Rick keeps paying her living expenses if she'll take Kelly back under her wing.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: A special series looking back at Bradley and Barney's previous American adventures. The first episode sees the pair start in Los Angeles. Kicking things off in Venice beach, the pair get in shape with a game of volleyball and pump some weights at Muscle Beach, but the following the day Bradley is pushed to his limits when Barney reveals he has arranged for them to go skydiving. Leaving Los Angeles behind them, they head into the desert towards Arizona as they venture onto the famous Route 66, where the pair head off to Cowboy College.

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: Sheron and Billy Dawson check in for some pool-side fun, bringing along their teenage son Rob, young daughter Jodie, and Grandad Eddie, to claim the sun-loungers left vacant following the Garveys' departure from the vacation spot. Meanwhile, resort boss Joyce Temple-Savage is desperate for new staff, and must choose between efficient, goody two-shoes Amber and the outrageously flirtatious Marcus, and Troy returns to Benidorm with Jacqueline and Kenneth to scatter Donald's ashes in the place he loved best. Julie Graham, Steve Edge and Bobby Knutt join the cast of the comedy drama set in the sun-kissed Solana resort.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five cinema workers from East Anglia, known collectively as the Popcorn Sweepers, answer questions based on top 10 lists, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round on subjects that include film, pop music, sport and food and drink. Warwick Davis hosts.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Freeze Out
programme.desc: Game show of skill and quizzing ability in which contestants compete at a giant circular ice table for the chance to manoeuvre gliding sliders on a giant game board, hoping to eventually secure a jackpot of £10,000. Hosted by Mark Durden-Smith, with former Premier League referee Uriah Rennie.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy.

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five sea-loving women from Eastbourne, Sussex, answer top 10-list questions on subjects including Downton Abbey, gin brands and languages. Quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on a large arcade-style 'coin-pusher' machine. The more counters they collect, the greater the prize fund, with the last one standing competing for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as another four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but anyone caught by the Chaser is out for good, leaving fewer players to team up and play in the final chase.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates another comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers. This time around, a delivery drone drops a painful parcel, a quad-bike rolls into a lake, and a baby steals a smartphone and spends a fortune on concert tickets.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family
programme.desc: In a reality TV special, former Gogglebox star and 2016 Queen of the Jungle Scarlett Moffatt takes on 2019 Love Island contestant Curtis Pritchard. The pair - along with their families - go head to head in the knockout tournament, hoping to advance to the next round. Presented by Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show: Live
programme.desc: As life in lockdown continues, Martin Lewis has up-to-the-minute advice for these financially uncertain times. He'll be taking viewers' questions on how the ongoing crisis affects family finances, jobs and consumer rights, and offers money-saving tips and tricks.

programme.title: Unbelievable Moments Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong presents a selection of extraordinary eyewitness footage filmed by members of the public, including the dramatic story of an amateur pilot who built his own plane, but then lost his propeller mid-flight and had to try to land it without any power. A local resident in northern California tries to flee what goes down in history as the state's deadliest wildfire, and a cliff collapse at a popular tourist spot in Greece causes chaos.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a Jensen Interceptor, but his £5,000 budget restricts him to poor examples of the car, leaving mechanic Edd China with plenty of work to do.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Junk expert Frank Fritz falls hard for a Harley Davidson 'knucklehead' at a collector's hidden California compound.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The second of four FANtasy bike winners is revealed as the guys head to Texas. The OCC crew spends some time with Susan Morisset to learn how best to customise her chopper. The winner heads out to OCC and gets a tour of the facility and a shopping spree at the retail store. Once receiving her bike, she and Sr go for a truly memorable ride.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: Chronicling 100 years of American aircraft achievements, from the early visionaries to the technological advancements of the modern bomber fleet.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe takes on a succession of unpleasant tasks, this time exploring the depths of Pit 91 before travelling north to find out how much of an animal can be recycled.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew visits the birthplace of the BMW M6 and explores its exterior.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew goes to its birthplace, revealing the inner workings and stunning exterior of the Rolls-Royce Dawn, regarded by many as a dream car.

programme.title: Steel Buddies
programme.desc: Michael embarks on some shopping trips to the US, tries to get his airplane business of the ground and races to deliver three school buses to Savannah port on time.

programme.title: Devonport: Inside the Royal Navy
programme.desc: HMS Bulwark returns from a vital humanitarian mission rescuing migrants in the Mediterranean, and a Devonport sailor takes his relaxation time to excessive new levels.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China restore a Jaguar XJS to its former glory.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China take the finished Jaguar XJS for a test drive and invite potential buyers to view it.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer takes a risk on a classic Jaguar E-type in poor condition, but quickly discovers the expense of buying parts as Edd China gets to work.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys an XK8 Jaguar in poor condition, giving mechanic Edd China a tough challenge to fix it up within a tight budget.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tracks down a Jaguar Mark 2 - but is later left to reflect whether the purchase has been a wise one as mechanic Edd China reports a list of serious defects.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer finds a Land Rover Discovery for £1,500 and hands it over to mechanic Edd China for restoration work.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mechanic Edd China finishes working on the Land Rover Discovery and, after a successful road test, Mike Brewer has a buyer lined up.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: After a nerve-racking test-drive, Mike Brewer buys a 1981 Series III Land Rover without an MOT for Edd China to restore.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a V8-powered Land Rover Defender for less than £5,000, that modifications expert Edd China can turn into a modern urban vehicle.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Edd China and Mike Brewer set the challenge to find the ultimate bug-out vehicle that would ceaselessly run, and decide on the Land Rover Series IIA.

programme.title: Plane Reclaimers
programme.desc: The arrival of a 747 Jumbo Jet has the team members itching to dismantle this giant of the sky. However, they immediately struggle fitting it into the parking bay.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: After an injury to one of their members, the Young Guns face a tough decision on how to continue mining. Meanwhile, the Cheals break through to a long-lost underground mine.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds one of only 1,000 Mini Cooper S MC40s ever made, the 40th anniversary homage to the Monte Carlo rally-winning British icon.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Painting conservator Lucia Scalisi faces a serious challenge when presented with a perforated painting by celebrated British artist Fred Appleyard.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A toy boat, a vintage gramophone and a doll suffering the effects of years of love and affection are restored by the experts.

programme.title: World's Greatest Motorcycle Rides
programme.desc: Part two of three. Henry Cole heads out from Apollo Bay to ride up towards Adelaide on one of the greatest roads in the world, the Great Ocean Road.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: After an injury to one of their members, the Young Guns face a tough decision on how to continue mining. Meanwhile, the Cheals break through to a long-lost underground mine.

programme.title: Jungle Gold
programme.desc: Having been kicked off their gold mine, Scott and George need to buy a new claim to keep their dreams alive. However, raising the necessary cash involves a dangerous deal.

programme.title: Secrets of the Underground
programme.desc: Rob Nelson investigates a cluster of ancient ruins in New England that suggest Europeans arrived in the Americas almost 1,000 years before Columbus.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The staff of Orange County Choppers build a specialised trike for the last winning fan, Bryan King, who was left paralysed after a car accident.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: The use of transport planes in Russian air assault operations, and an examination of recent designs such as jet seaplanes.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe heads to Queen Creek, Arizona, to press olives into oil, before cleaning dirty diapers in Sacramento.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes involved in manufacturing rope, billiard tables and sailboards, and how advances in technology have led to improved production methods.

programme.title: How It's Made
